channel.title: Marc Barrowclift
channel.description: Some guy on the internet rambling about Apple, technology, and whatever else pops up.

item.title: My Other Post
item.description:
THIS IS THE IMPORTANT ONE üçª By using current technology, you can be identified based on nothing more than your writing style (See the Privacy, Security, and Automation lab‚Äôs publications here). This is a very troubling issue, especially in light of the NSA‚Äôs Prism reveal, which makes it very easy for them to attribute anonymous publications simply by checking it against their databases and using existing tools such as JGAAP and JStylo. This means that whistle blowers, who wish to remain anonymous, ‚Äúmay be unknowingly revealing‚Äù themselves whenever they post new material.

Here is a block quote:

This is a blockquote with two paragraphs. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aliquam hendrerit mi posuere lectus. Vestibulum enim wisi, viverra nec, fringilla in, laoreet vitae, risus.

Donec sit amet nisl. Aliquam semper ipsum sit amet velit. Suspendisse id sem consectetuer libero luctus adipiscing.

This problem isn‚Äôt exclusive to government whistle blowers; journalists and authors wishing to publish works under a pen name may also be at risk with these rising technologies. For example, J.K. Rowling‚Äôs recent work The Cuckoo‚Äôs Calling was originally published under the alias, Robert Galbraith. Using JGAAP, an authorship detection tool he developed, Patrick Juola made a strong case for Rowling being the true author. This ultimately led to her confession (see here for the whole story).

Here‚Äôs a picture I found that I think articulates my point really well. This problem isn‚Äôt exclusive to government whistle blowers; journalists and authors wishing to publish works under a pen name may also be at risk with these rising technologies. For example, J.K. Rowling‚Äôs recent work The Cuckoo‚Äôs Calling was originally published under the alias, Robert Galbraith. Using JGAAP, an authorship detection tool he developed, Patrick Juola made a strong case for Rowling being the true author. This ultimately led to her confession (see here for the whole story).

Look at it. LOOK AT IT! This problem isn‚Äôt exclusive to government whistle blowers; journalists and authors wishing to publish works under a pen name may also be at risk with these rising technologies. For example, J.K. Rowling‚Äôs recent work The Cuckoo‚Äôs Calling was originally published under the alias, Robert Galbraith. Using JGAAP, an authorship detection tool he developed, Patrick Juola made a strong case for Rowling being the true author. This ultimately led to her confession (see here for the whole story).

The members were as follows:

  1. Dr. Frank Lee - Project head, original idea. This is a test of a lot of text in a bulleted or listed item. I wonder how it will look.
  2. Dr. Santiago Ontanon - Pong, assistant programmer
  3. Gaylord Holder - Networking, LED map parser, assistant programmer
  4. Marc Barrowclift - Display manager, Tetris, Snake, and GUI game tester

Also, it‚Äôs important that I get unordered lists to look nice as well. Here‚Äôs an example of one of those unordered lists:

  • This is a test
  • So is this
  • La de da de da de da
  • Foo bar

As you can see, this is a huge problem, but what can we do to protect ourselves? Enter Anonymouth. Anonymouth has grown enormously over the past two years and is just nearing a stable 0.6 Beta. While there is still much work to be done, its current version provides users with the basic tools necessary to help them begin anonymizing their documents.

Some Other Thing

As you can see, this is a huge problem, but what can we do to protect ourselves? Enter Anonymouth. Anonymouth has grown enormously over the past two years and is just nearing a stable 0.6 Beta. While there is still much work to be done, its current version provides users with the basic tools necessary to help them begin anonymizing their documents.

Look at it. LOOK AT IT! This problem isn‚Äôt exclusive to government whistle blowers; journalists and authors wishing to publish works under a pen name may also be at risk with these rising technologies. For example, J.K. Rowling‚Äôs recent work The Cuckoo‚Äôs Calling was originally published under the alias, Robert Galbraith. Using JGAAP, an authorship detection tool he developed, Patrick Juola made a strong case for Rowling being the true author. This ultimately led to her confession (see here for the whole story).

item.title: My Test Post
item.description:
Heading (h1)

Heading (h3)

Heading (h4)

This is sample text to represent a paragraph this is what a block of test will look like. Now I‚Äôm just going to write a ton of bullshit and hope that it looks good when processed with an appropriate markdown style sheet. I hope it will all look okay in the end my god this is a pain in the god damn ass I can‚Äôt wait for this to be done.

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You‚Äôll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

There‚Äôs a cool thing with pictures as well. Here‚Äôs a picture:

That‚Äôs one thing, here‚Äôs another thing. Blah blah blah I don‚Äôt know what to type this is so close ot being done.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

That‚Äôs one thing, here‚Äôs another thing. Blah blah blah I don‚Äôt know what to type this is so close ot being done.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

/** My test class */
public class Test {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println("Hello, world!");
		System.out.println("This is another test");
		int i = 5;
		int b = 2;
		int result = i + b;
		return;
	}
}

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll‚Äôs GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll‚Äôs dedicated Help repository.

By using current technology, you can be identified based on nothing more than your writing style (See the Privacy, Security, and Automation lab‚Äôs publications here). This is a very troubling issue, especially in light of the NSA‚Äôs Prism reveal, which makes it very easy for them to attribute anonymous publications simply by checking it against their databases and using existing tools such as JGAAP and JStylo. This means that whistle blowers, who wish to remain anonymous, may be unknowingly revealing themselves whenever they post new material1

This problem isn‚Äôt exclusive to government whistle blowers; journalists and authors wishing to publish works under a pen name may also be at risk with these rising technologies. For example, J.K. Rowling‚Äôs recent work The Cuckoo‚Äôs Calling was originally published under the alias, Robert Galbraith2. Using JGAAP, an authorship detection tool he developed, Patrick Juola made a strong case for Rowling being the true author. This ultimately led to her confession (see here for the whole story).

The members were as follows:

  1. Dr. Frank Lee - Project head, original idea. This is a test of the thing. doo dee doo This is the first item.
  2. Dr. Santiago Ontanon - Pong, assistant programmer
  3. Gaylord Holder - Networking, LED map parser, assistant programmer
  4. Marc Barrowclift - Display manager, Tetris, Snake, and GUI game tester

As you can see, this is a huge problem, but what can we do to protect ourselves? Enter Anonymouth. Anonymouth has grown enormously over the past two years and is just nearing a stable 0.6 Beta. While there is still much work to be done, its current version provides users with the basic tools necessary to help them begin anonymizing their documents.

  1. I have something interesting to say! Herp derp lerp burb. ↩

  2. Let‚Äôs not go to Camelot, ‚Äòtis a silly place. This is an extremely long thing, I‚Äôm not even kidding here just look how fucking long this shit is, it‚Äôs nuts. This is probably the longest footnote in the history of footnotes, my god this needs it‚Äôs own article whyyyy ↩

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You‚Äôll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

/** My test class */
public class Test {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println("Hello, world!");
	}
}

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll‚Äôs GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll‚Äôs dedicated Help repository.
